kr.ac.mju.islab

Class RewardServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • kr.ac.mju.islab.RewardServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class RewardServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    RewardServer class is a server-side concrete implementation of 'Privacy-Aware Reward System'.

    RewardServer responds to query from a client-side concrete implementation, which are RewardQuery objects.

    If you are only interested on application, you do not need to check detailed class like RewardScheme.

    Since:
    2017-03-08
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    jwlee

    • Constructor Detail

      • RewardServer

        public RewardServer(java.lang.String bindAddr,
                    int bindPort,
                    RewardScheme rewardScheme)
        Class constructor specifying bind address, bind port, and a object of RewardScheme which is used as an engine of RewardServer.
        Parameters:
        bindAddr - the bind address of the server. usually 127.0.0.1
        bindPort - the bind port of the server
        rewardScheme - the object of RewardScheme. You can define custom parameters on it

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        RewardScheme implements Runnable, so could act as thread.

        Usage:
        Thread rewardServer = new Thread(new RewardServer("127.0.0.1", 3575, new RewardScheme()));
        rewardServer.start();

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
